questions.question_text: A cybersecurity analyst traced the source of an attack to compromised user credentials. Log analysis revealed that the attacker successfully authenticated from an unauthorized foreign country. Management asked the security analyst to research and implement a solution to help mitigate attacks based on compromised passwords. Which of the following should the analyst implement?

discussion.content: This question was in the exam :)
Answer is C - "the attacker successfully authenticated from an unauthorized foreign country."
C - Context-based authentication builds risk assessment capabilities into access decisions by analyzing user behavior. A login from a user in a foreign country is atypical and should raise flags.

comments.content: On a second thot and re-reading the ques, answer is correct

discussion.content: Should be D. Question does mention foreign country and we could have location based authentication for context but the question is asking for password compromise mitigation.

questions.question_text: A technician is running an intensive vulnerability scan to detect which ports are open to exploit. During the scan, several network services are disabled and production is affected. Which of the following sources would be used to evaluate which network service was interrupted?

discussion.content: syslog provides info on services, with 'info only', 'critical' messages, etc.
Everything should be going into the syslog server. Starts and stops of network devices and services within them.
NIDS is the answer.
Answer A. Similar Q on 002

questions.question_text: A software patch has been released to remove vulnerabilities from company's software. A security analyst has been tasked with testing the software to ensure the vulnerabilities have been remediated and the application is still functioning properly. Which of the following tests should be performed NEXT?

discussion.content: After modifing software we use regression test
Answer is C- Similar Q on 002

choices.C: Forensic review of the server required fall-back on a less efficient service.
choices.A: PII of company employees and customers was exfiltrated.
choices.B: Raw financial information about the company was accessed.
choices.D: IP addresses and other network-related configurations were exfiltrated.
choices.E: The local root password for the affected server was compromised.

discussion.content: This question was in the exam :)
and had been sending between 150 and 500 megabytes of data each time. Exflitrated

comments.content: does this mean in the actual exam for 002?

discussion.content: Answer A - Similar Q on 002

questions.question_text: During a routine review of firewall logs, an analyst identified that an IP address from the organization's server subnet had been connecting during nighttime hours to a foreign IP address, and had been sending between 150 and 500 megabytes of data each time. This had been going on for approximately one week, and the affected server was taken offline for forensic review. Which of the following is MOST likely to drive up the incident's impact assessment?

A security analyst is performing a forensic analysis on a machine that was the subject of some historic SIEM alerts. The analyst noticed some network connections utilizing SSL on non-common ports, copies of svchost.exe and cmd.exe in %TEMP% folder, and RDP files that had connected to external IPs. Which of the following threats has the security analyst uncovered?

discussion.content: This question was in the exam :)
B. APT right answer
Control and Command -copies of svchost.exe and cmd.exe in %TEMP% folder, and RDP files that had connected to external IPs. APT
Answer B - APT. Similar Q on 002
APT is the answer.
Those are all software vulnerabilities, however especially "RDP files that had connected to external IPs" definitely shows that APT involved and this is an attack.
APTs are usually the right answer when an exam has them as an option.
yeah Its B
B. APT should not be that Advanced guys doing such tricks > ? not sure about SW issue.
